text: I feel like I'm a sensitive soul, or an internal weather system on turbo-mode with constantly changing emotions.
My emotions change rapidly and unpredictably, like a weather system with no pattern.
I experience intense mood swings that feel out of my control.
I have difficulty regulating my emotions and they often feel overwhelming.
I feel like my emotional reactions are much stronger than what the situation calls for.
I struggle to maintain emotional stability and my moods can shift dramatically within hours or even minutes.
I have difficulty recovering from emotional upsets and they affect me for extended periods.
I feel like my emotions are on turbo-mode, constantly shifting and changing without warning.
I experience intense emotional reactions to small triggers that others might not even notice.
I feel like my emotional instability interferes with my relationships, work, or daily functioning.
I can maintain emotional stability and regulate my moods effectively.
I can recover from emotional upsets relatively quickly and don't let them affect me for extended periods.
I have good emotional regulation skills and can manage my feelings effectively.
My emotional reactions are generally proportional to the situation and don't feel overwhelming.
I can maintain consistent emotional stability without dramatic mood swings.
I feel like my emotions are constantly changing and I can't predict how I'll feel from one moment to the next.
I experience intense emotional highs and lows that feel out of my control.
I feel like my emotional instability makes it difficult to maintain stable relationships or commitments.
I have difficulty managing my emotional responses and they often feel overwhelming or unmanageable.
I can maintain emotional balance and stability without experiencing dramatic mood swings.
